author: Azure_sea
title: Best "cheap" sets of the line
review:
I feel this set has great balance in the sender that the goblin and his outpost is a formidable for for Naida and her gondala.

I love the gold pieces used as one of the accent colours and the majestic gold price on the tail of the gondala.

I this set would probably be my favourite set of the line if it included and animal companion for Naida.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Fun addition to LEGO Elves.
review:
Set #41181 Naida’s Gondola & the Goblin Thief: I am a huge fan of LEGO Elves, sadly I haven’t been able to get as many of the sets as I would like, it is unfortunate, but not the end of the world. This year introduces an entirely new element where the Elves must rescue Emily’s sister from the Goblin King and his mischievous looking little Goblins. It’s an interesting concept and many of the sets are very fun looking, this is the cheapest offer from this wave and possibly one of the best sets to get outside the largest ones.

Box/Instructions

Box: For this year of LEGO Elves, IE 2017, the box design was not changed drastically. However a new piece of artwork was included showing the Elves and Emily preparing to use their magic against the Goblin King who has Emily’s sister in a cage behind him. The back shows even more, with some great artwork of the Goblins, the Elves and everything else, plus of course the set and its features. Overall a really impressive box design.

Instructions: The instruction manual for this set is pretty much what you would expect to see from Elves, the art on the box has been repeated on the front of the manual while the back includes a nifty checklist for all the sets available in the wave. It’s a good manual that serves well.

Parts

In this LEGO Elves set there are not a whole lot of unique parts for those searching for them, that being said the back of the boat features a very nice looking golden piece for the rudder and there are some, though not many, typical plant pieces in this set.

Mini-Doll

Naida: I enjoy the look of the Elves immeasurably and Naida is no exception, her element is water and she has a gorgeous looking outfit all in rich blues with some aqua highlights. For accessories she includes jewels, a single smooth blue stud to represent her magic and another one for a compass, as well as a printed tile with a map showing how to reach the Goblin King’s hideout where he’s stashed Emily’s little sister. She looks great and I’m pleased to finally add her to my collection.

Roblin: Roblin the Goblin is a new single piece element with moveable arms that was created exclusively for LEGO Elves, this new piece features some nice sculpt work to make it look like a little goblin creature, and includes impressive printing for the outfit he is wearing with a menacing looking belt buckle shaped into an eye and some pouches and things filled with mysterious items.

For accessories he includes a printed tile detailing what he’s after, according to what the picture on the box seems to indicate he’s trying to steal some jewels from Naida, I have no idea why, but that’s what the image indicates. He also a chicken leg for a quick meal while he’s waiting for the Elf to show up in her Gondola.

The build

This build was what I’ve come to expect from small 12.99$ based sets. It was fast, uncomplicated and relatively enjoyable with no tricky or troublesome parts for younger builders. This is because sets of this size are designed for quick pick-up-and-play fun and they rarely disappoint, the Gondola model was a very enjoyable bit of fun, and the small Goblin Outpost looks great and was a treat to build.

The completed model

Gondola: This is a really smart looking little boat for Naida to ride in, I really enjoy all of the detailing LEGO managed to include in it, from the rear lantern (of no doubt mystical origins) using a standard Minifigure head in clear blue with a gold stud on top, to the impressive newly designed element that makes up the rudder which looks like a small dragon’s tail, or possibly a curved branch on a tree, this model is really strong and fun looking.

Goblin Outpost: The mischievously wicked goblin has a massive looking rocky outcropping on the edge of a lake, which uses a lot of fun pieces, including a few lime green teeth pieces for ivy or other plant camouflage. He also includes a catapult that launches… flowers? Ummm, I suppose that might upset Naida, but I don’t see how it could sink her boat or hurt her in any meaningful way. Still, it could be worse I suppose.

Overall opinion

This is a really great little set and if you can still find it I strongly recommend tracking it down. It’s got some really nice mini-dolls and features a lot of fun playability. On top of that there’s some nice printed elements in the set and everything can be used to have fun with a little story involving the search for Emily Jones’ little sister.

author: Lonewolf5529
title: Small, but not bad
review:
So, this will be my first review.  Just getting back into LEGO - I had a bunch as a kid, but gave them all away to a friend's kid when I was in my 20s.  Started buying again recently because I couldn't resist the Elves sets anymore.

But about the set.   So this is kinda smallish, with not much to build.  Still I'm digging the Elves figures and Naida is no exception.  Love the elemental theme with them.  Naida, clearly the water elf here, is taking treasure down the river and is waylaid by the goblin.  I love the little details, like the goblin having a little plaque with instructions.  And his little snack while he keeps watch with the telescope.  Naida's compass and magic lantern are also nice touches.

Compared to other Elves sets I got, not many moving parts here, just the back of the ship (some kind of magical rudder, I guess) and the goblin's little catapult.

From the listings here, this appears to be early in the lineup for 2017, so it would not have been clear what the little purple flowers were supposed to do as ammo.  Of course in later sets we find out that is the nascent form of the carnivorous plants that the goblins are so fond of.

Overall, a nice, if smallish, set and a good intro to the Elves line.
